reviews.text:
This review is about the restaurant, not the hotel.

It's a Jewish restaurant, but it has a lot more than just hummus. It was my first time trying cholent and I loved it! I also tried the stuffed onion and found it to be average. For dessert, the halva was delicious.

The staff speaks English and is friendly. The restaurant is beautiful.

Never stayed here but one of my absolut hidden gems in krakow , beautiful quaint old traditional Jews book shop with a small concert room and small dining room / coffee shop . Love visiting here for a unique experience,  not expensive , great food and large alchol list , traditional Jewish Polish menu , nice deserts too . Definitely worth finding atleast once , but I visit every time in close

The place is very cozy. The food is pretty good, with big and tasty portions. However, the concert was just a very huge disappointment. You have to pay additionally to listen to live music. The musicians were so bored that I had the feeling they are going to fall asleep. They were playing really bad. Absolute waste of money and time.
Fantastic traditional Jewish food and an amazing live concert. They also have a great bookshop with posters and post cards. Highly recommend!

Whilst visiting Krakow we visited Klezmer Hois for lunch (recommended by a friend). It was like stepping back in time and visiting a great grandparents house! The food was excellent and the atmosphere was really lovely. The staff were helpful when we asked about some of the menu items
